title: Ticket #6205: condor_top using python bindings (condor_top.py)
description:
condor_top.pl (#6067) is not a user-friendly script in that it requires users to dump ClassAds from a daemon (e.g. using condor_status) at regular intervals. Using the HTCondor Python bindings, we can query daemon ClassAds directly and update stats on a timer, much like how the *nix tool top works.

remarks:
2017-Apr-05 16:37:33 by jpatton:
Initial version:
  • Help is invoked with ./condor_top.py -h
  • Tries to use smart defaults to query the right daemon (COLLECTOR_HOST if collector/negotiator/master, FULL_HOSTNAME if schedd/startd)
  • Warns if multiple ClassAds are returned (user should specify NAME using -n)
  • Fits to size of console if on Linux, otherwise assumes 25 rows x 80 cols
